sentences.sContent: In his early 20s, bin Laden worked in the family business; he was a priggish young man who was also studying economics at a university.
sentences.sContent_eng: In his early 20s, bin Laden worked in the family business; he was a priggish young man who was also studying economics at a university.
sentences.sCn: 在20岁出头的时候，本•拉登在自家的买卖中工作，同时在一所大学学习经济。 他是一个古板的年轻人。

synos.tran: 一本正经的；自负的；死板的

trans.tranCn: 一本正经的；自负的；死板的
trans.tranOther: If you describe someone as priggish, you think that they are a prig
